pkgmetadata.longdescription: # AFEX SSO (DJANGO)## Simple Integration (usage)instantiate the SSO class from AFEX_SSO import SSO sso = SSO() def get_user_details(View): sso_instance = sso.check_credentials(session_key) get_user = sso_instance['data'].get('user') ''' # other codes ''' def logout(View): # get user email email = " " signout = sso.sign_out(email) ''' # other codes '''## Keys- session_key : sent from the service provider client (frontend) after successful authentication on the sso ## SETTINGS- set the sso details on settings.py as shown below - SSO_URL = "" - SSO_API_KEY = "" - SSO_SECRET_KEY = ""### Sample Response { "responseCode": "100", "data": { "session_identifier": "SES_2c73ff51cfe5c5a68fc58934c9be3b", "user": { "email": "example@africaexchange.com", "first_name": "Ayodeji", "last_name": "Balogun", "photo": null, "tribe": null, "designation": "Software Developer", "email_aliases": [ "example@afexnigeria.com", ] } }, "message": "Successfully Retrieved" }
